Sam. 24.15, preached at a weekely lecture in Deuon, in those fearefull times of mortalitie by J.P. Master of Arts and minister of the gospell
monogr.author: Pyne, John

div.head: To the Reader.
div.p: ANd thus Gentle Reader, I haue communicated vnto thy view these precedent pape •• which were penned (for the most part) in great want of time, a • thou are already aduertised. Yet are they sent abroad, without adding, altering, augmenting or amending of any materiall passage; that so they may follow their originall Copy, which (together with another Tract, not yet published) found acceptance at the hands of our Dread and Deare Soueraigne. In respect of whose gracious Aspect, I haue the more cause to presume of thy fauour, or (if that may not bee obtayned) the lesse reason to esteeme thy Censure.
